alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:29AM CST until February 03 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Wabash River at Terre Haute. Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site. Wabash River at Covington. Wabash River at Montezuma. Wabash River at Lafayette. Wabash River at Riverton. Wabash River at Clinton. .Lowland flooding has developed along the Wabash from a combination of precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall. Minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 03... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...Until Saturday, February 03. * IMPACTS...At 20.5 feet, Flooding behind the Honey Creek levee becomes rather extensive. Most low roads are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Friday /9:30 AM CST Friday/ the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Friday /9:30 AM CST Friday/ was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.7 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, February 02. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 230 AM EST /130 AM CST/.
